title.narrative: PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education, the governing bodies of the justice system and other service providers possess the knowledge, strategies and tools to prevent violence against school-age children and adolescents, with a genderbased, intercultural approach and the capacity to respond to emergencies.

mailing-address.narrative: Av. Amazonas 2889 y La Granja Edificio Naciones Unidas Quito

sector.narrative: Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

title.narrative: Ecuador United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ecuador Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Growing Up without Violence)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Ecuador: Multi-country evaluation on Violence Against Children and Gender-Based Violence - Ecuador Case Study
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education, the governing bodies of the justice system and other service providers possess the knowledge, strategies and tools to prevent violence against school-age children and adolescents, with a genderbased, intercultural approach and the capacity to respond to emergencies.

description.narrative: UNICEF CO supported development of methodologies, tools and policy to prevent violence in education communities and monitored their implementation and field results. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of children and adolescents between 5 to 19 years old who take part of life skills programmes supported by UNICEF in prioritized territories.

baseline.value: 40,000 (this is the initial model that is the base for the design of a peace education strategy)

actual.value: 2019:The strategy is developed and in implementation. More than 98599 students were reached in 2019.

title.narrative: Ministry of Education has a new evidence based proposal for its life skills programme to prevent violence in educational communities

baseline.value: Current life skills initiative in schools nationwide not institutionalized

target.value: 2022:Piloting and systematization (including costing) of the implementation of the new life skills education programme in prioritized territories

actual.value: 2019:Weekly life skills hour for all grades implemented universally. The hour was established in 2018 as of UNICEF´s recommendation to the Ministry of Education.
